| Short Description | Long Description |
| --- | --- |
| Inconvenient Bike Parking | Bikers need a secure location to park their bikes during work hours without worrying about theft or damage. |
| Lack of Shower Facilities | Bikers need access to shower facilities upon arrival to work in order to freshen up after their commute. |
| Bike Maintenance Difficulty | Many bike commuters lack the expertise or time to maintain their bikes, leading to costly repairs and interruptions to their commuting routine. |
| Distracted Drivers | Bike commuters face a significant risk of injury or death on the road due to drivers who are distracted or texting while driving. |
| Limited Route Safety Information | Bike commuters require clear information about safe bike routes, potential hazards, and estimated commute times. |
| Poor Road Quality | Bikers require roads that are free from potholes, obstructions, and other hazards that can cause accidents or bike malfunction. |
| Noisy and Polluted Routes | Bikers may face inhospitable environments, such as high levels of noisy traffic or air pollution, which can detract from the enjoyment of their commute. |
| Limited Bike-Friendly Housing | Many bike commuters may face difficulty in finding affordable housing options that provide adequate bike storage and maintenance facilities. |
| Poor Weather Conditions | Bikers may face significant disruptions to their commutes due to poor weather conditions, such as heavy rain or snow. |
| Limited Access to Commuting Resources | Bikers require access to resources such as bike safety training, mapping software, equipment, and gear in order to make their commutes easier and more enjoyable. |
